titles.en: THE BOOK OF BELIEF (Emān) AND DISBELIEF (KUFR)

titles.ar: بَابُ إِذَا أَرَادَ اللَّهُ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ أَنْ يَخْلُقَ الْمُؤْمِنَ
titles.en: Chapter 8 – When Allah<sup>azwj</sup> Mighty and Majestic Intended to Create the Believer

titles.ar: بَابُ إِذَا أَرَادَ اللَّهُ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ أَنْ يَخْلُقَ الْمُؤْمِنَ
titles.en: Chapter 8 – When Allah<sup>azwj</sup> Mighty and Majestic Intended to Create the Believer

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: مجهول - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (66/ 7)
text: مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنِ ابْنِ فَضَّالٍ عَنْ إِبْرَاهِيمَ بْنِ مُسْلِمٍ الْحُلْوَانِيِّ عَنْ أَبِي إِسْمَاعِيلَ الصَّيْقَلِ الرَّازِيِّ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ إِنَّ فِي الْجَنَّةِ لَشَجَرَةً تُسَمَّى الْمُزْنَ فَإِذَا أَرَادَ اللَّهُ أَنْ يَخْلُقَ مُؤْمِناً أَقْطَرَ مِنْهَا قَطْرَةً فَلَا تُصِيبُ بَقْلَةً وَ لَا ثَمَرَةً أَكَلَ مِنْهَا مُؤْمِنٌ أَوْ كَافِرٌ إِلَّا أَخْرَجَ اللَّهُ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ مِنْ صُلْبِهِ مُؤْمِناً .

en.hubeali: Muhammad Bin Yahya, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad, from Ibn Fazzal, from Ibrahim Bin Muslim Al Halwany, from Abu Ismail Al Sayqal Al Razy,

(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘In the Paradise there is a tree named as Al-Muzna (Nimbus). So when Allah<sup>azwj</sup> Intends to Create a Believer, a drop falls from it. So it neither hits a vegetable nor a fruit, nor a date which either a Believer or a disbeliever eats from it, except that Allah<sup>azwj</sup> Mighty and Majestic Brings him out from his back, as a Believer’.
en.sarwar: 1. Muhammad ibn Yahya has narrated from Ahmad ibn Muhammad from ibn Faddal from Ibrahim ibn Muslim al-Hulwani from abu Isma’il al-Sayqal al-Razi from abu ‘Abd Allah (a.s.) who has said the following: “In paradise there is a tree called al-Muzn. When Allah wants to create a believer He makes a drop to drip from it. It then falls on vegetable or fruit that either a believer or unbeliever then consumes for food but Allah, the Most Majestic, the Most Glorious, brings out a believer from his back.”
